A few shows have now sold out. Tickets are disappearing fast for Banbury, Brighton, Buxton, Colchester, Kendal, London, Milton Keynes, Norwich, Nottingham, Sale, Selby, Sheffield.

I’ll be at a number of festivals over the coming few months, including Hay-on-Wye, Morecambe. Tickets for Derby, Portsmouth and Glasgow will go on sale soon.

title: Country Overshoot Days 2023 - Earth Overshoot Day

last_post.content:
Well done #Sweden! Bra jobbat #Sverige! Today is our #CountryOvershootDay!
It was a tough ask, but today, working together, consuming like we know we must, we have used up our share of Earth's resources for the whole of 2023.
From now to December, we are stealing from less wealthy people, from our own children, from our own futures.
Why not go out for a drive to celebrate? Or book an(other) international flight?
https://www.overshootday.org/newsroom/country-overshoot-days/
#ClimateJustice #Sustainability #EarthOvershootDay

"Good place-language, well used, opens onto mystery, grows knowledge, and summons wonder. title: Bradley's: Lager and Shots in No-Man's Land

last_post.content:
I get very, very bored of celebs and opinion writers talking about how they dislike #london.

So when London In Bits asked me to write about why I love my city, how could I say no?

title: Python Plotting With Matplotlib (Guide) – Real Python

last_post.content:
This is a great intro to how matplotlib works under the hood: https://realpython.com/python-matplotlib-guide/

If you're a beginner like me, you're mindlessly copy/pasting from examples and remaining confused about the difference between figures and axes, thinking that the whole thing is object oriented (after all, it's python...) and therefore plt.plot() must be a method for the plt object (it's NOT!), why the heck we call plt.subplots() when there is only a single plot, etc. Prepare to be enlightened!

#matplotlib

Include - Accessibility Annotations: https://www.figma.com/community/plugin/1208180794570801545/Include%E2%80%94Accessibility-Annotations
This is a a useful Figma plugin to help you annotate landmarks, focus groups (native), headings, reading order, alternative text (for images, it’s missing icons for now), check touch target, color contrast, create de 200% version of your page, document complex gestures (native) and more. It’s not perfect yet (and there is a feedback form) but it’s honestly the most advanced plugin I found so far. So, big kudos to the ebay team!

Hi there, I recently joined here. I'm the admin of vezvez-e kandū („the humming of the beehive“), a research blog dedicated to Iranian Studies from a Cultural Science & Digital Humanities perspective. It's also home to a Digital Toolbox, a research repository currently featuring 830 digital resources relevant to Iranian Studies & related fields. I'm working on a relaunch of the website and several new features for the toolbox. As always, all feedback is appreciated!
https://www.vezveze-kandu.de

R.I.P. Ryuichi Sakamoto, a Japanese musical legend, an activist, my inspiration.

title: Training-Free Structured Diffusion Guidance for Compositional Text-to-Image Synthesis

last_post.content: Other models followed, in November came Midjourney v4 and in December Structured Diffusion Guidance (https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.05032). Better composition was notably easier to achieve. This allowed me to proceed with (and complete) my tasks of illustration of fairy tales. All resulting images can be seen in the paper, but the other important outcome is the definition of a preliminary process for the generation of images aligned to the original story text.

title: How to Make the Most of E-Books, and Find Free Ones

last_post.content:
I love the availability via e-books of older books now in public domain: classics like Jane Austen and Mark Twain, as well as more obscure books you won't find in your local library. Perfect as we start #PoetryMonth!

My favorite source of classics is Project Gutenberg. For less well-known non-fiction (especially but not exclusively) try Hathi Trust.

Doing my part for IF Source Code Amnesty day: I've uploaded the source code for my games Flight of the Hummingbird (2010) and Atrocitron (2016) to the archive. They haven't made it to their final spots in the archive yet, but in the meantime I wrote an article about some of the sillier things I did while writing them.

In the meantime, they're at https://ifarchive.org/indexes/if-archive/unprocessed/ but that link won't stay valid for long.

title: Scientists outline key policies for degrowth in the fight against climate change

last_post.content:
Degrowth policies would be effective in fighting against climate breakdown and biodiversity loss and would secure human needs and well-being. Recent reports by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) and the Intergovernmental Science Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES) suggest that this approach should be considered.

Wrote: @Snoro

https://phys.org/news/2022-12-scientists-outline-key-policies-degrowth.html

title: Never in my 20 years of working in tech have I ever been treated so unprofessionally and with such disrespect as I have than with this most recent interview and offer with Levee

last_post.content: Never in 20 years of working in tech have I been treated so unprofessionally - https://startupdreams.substack.com/p/never-in-my-20-years-of-working-in

This is super interesting.

(I took the relevant screenshot)

"The lawyers also don’t yet know the charges because it’s a sealed indictment."

Generally the defendants know the charges at this stage.

Two possibilities:
🔹 Things are really different in NY (I doubt this)
🔹 Trump and his lawyers behaved so unprofessionally and uncivilly that there were not the usual discussions.

What this means is NOBODY knows what the charges are because the source has been Trump.

1/

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/02/briefing/donald-trump-indictment-arrest.html
